ygData.subject: Re: Random Spawining
ygData.msgSnippet: I know random spawning would be fustrating, but it would make our world more realistic then knowing excatly where a NPC pops up and how long it will take.
ygData.messageBody:
I know random spawning would be fustrating, but it would make our
"world" more realistic then knowing excatly where a NPC pops up and how
long it will take. It would almost be better if they locked certain
items in a chest deep in dungeons that you would have to be a crazy high
level tto fight your way through to get... and to hold your position.
then when the chest "spawns" again (and again I think it should be
random thoughout the hardest level of the dungeon) you will be assured
of getting your prize.

Another option which I like is to allow a character to get a lore item
once only. If they sell it or trade it, then they will not get it off a
corpse again, nor will someone be able to give it to them with out it
DISAPPEARING!!! that'll make you think! And prevent a lot of those
bastards for camping out for Crush, etc

I also hate wizards... I got a rogue friend decked out in antimagic
armour and has a bloodclaw who is going around challenging thse
"Powerful" wizards to a duel, then dicing them up! he he he


Baelstorm

Solusek Ro Thinktank

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Heather M. Daley [SMTP:blushn@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 12:18 PM
> To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] rez question
>
> From: "Heather M. Daley" <blushn@...>
>
> I don't think a random NPC pop will do it, it only causes frustration,
> honestly i don't know what the solution is, but how many times have
> you Seen
> Rahotep, or Hatar, or Quillmane, or Whimsy Larktwitter for that
> matter,
> people have to sit around, get a ranger or druid to track and waste
> countless hours for a NPC that never populates.....I hate camping with
> a
> passion, i love to adventure, but in order to get these " special "
> items we
> end up in zones that give us little to no experience waiting on one
> NPC who
> may or may not have what your looking for and then some wizard comes
> along
> once you do find it and steals the bastard, very frustrating IMHO
>
> Bree Wyndsdale
> 34th Cleric of Fennin Ro
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Squires, Dean <DeanSquires@...>
> To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com' <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>

>

> >From: "Squires, Dean" <DeanSquires@...>
> >
> >An easy way to cure camping is to randomize the NPC Spawning within
> the
> >zone, only then to make its way to a particular point. So, if you
> wait
> >at the point, he *may* come along, unless someone else crossed his
> path
> >before he got there.
> >
> >Baelstorm
> >
